when_to_say: Used to greet someone in the afternoon.
example: こんにちは、元気ですか？ (konnichiwa, genki desu ka?) - Hello, how are you?

when_to_say: Used to express that something tastes good.
example: このケーキは美味しい！ (kono keeki wa oishii!) - This cake is delicious!

when_to_say: Used when expressing difficulty.
example: この問題はとても難しいです。 (kono mondai wa totemo muzukashii desu) - This problem is very difficult.

when_to_say: Used when describing running or moving fast.
example: 彼は毎朝公園を走ります。 (kare wa maiasa kouen o hashirimasu) - He runs in the park every morning.

when_to_say: Used when expressing difficulty.
example: この問題はとても難しいです。 (kono mondai wa totemo muzukashii desu) - This problem is very difficult.

when_to_say: Used when describing running or moving fast.
example: 彼は毎朝公園を走ります。 (kare wa maiasa kouen o hashirimasu) - He runs in the park every morning.

when_to_say: Used when parting for a long time.
example: さようなら、また会いましょう。 (sayounara, mata aimashou) - Goodbye, let's meet again.

example: こんにちは、元気ですか？ (konnichiwa, genki desu ka?) - Hello, how are you?

when_to_say: Used when describing running or moving fast.
example: 彼は毎朝公園を走ります。 (kare wa maiasa kouen o hashirimasu) - He runs in the park every morning.

when_to_say: Used when describing running or moving fast.
example: 彼は毎朝公園を走ります。 (kare wa maiasa kouen o hashirimasu) - He runs in the park every morning.

when_to_say: Used when describing running or moving fast.
example: 彼は毎朝公園を走ります。 (kare wa maiasa kouen o hashirimasu) - He runs in the park every morning.

when_to_say: Used when parting for a long time.
example: さようなら、また会いましょう。 (sayounara, mata aimashou) - Goodbye, let's meet again.
